pros: The people and students who work here are all really nice! While it does depend on what department you are in, the departments that I worked for had a positive work environment and were enjoyable to work for.
cons: They don't pay that well overall.

review_title: Lovely place to work if you can get by with a low salary.
pros: Incredible colleagues, fantastic students, great intellectual environment.
cons: Low salary, lack of ability for financial advancement, higher-up administration sometimes unaware of the realities of their staff's working conditions.

review_title: Decent stipend; good work; not great living accommodations
job_title: Student Faculty Research Assistant in Appleton, WI
pros: Summer research was intellectually fulfilling and the stipend covered expenses
cons: Pay was only enough to survive on and I'd have made much more working somewhere else; additionally the summer housing accommodations were terrible.

pros: Love working at Lawrence as a sound technician!
cons: No bad sides to working here!

review_title: Good job at smaller athletic department

pros: Managers are nice and supportive. Many opportunities for bonuses each term.

job_title: Head Residence Life Advisor in Appleton, WI
pros: Working for LU Campus Life changed my life. I learned so much about the complexities of being behind the scenes and gained a ton of leadership skills. I also made lifelong friends, with all of us sharing a common goal of making the campus a better, safer place. Campus Life leaders love what they do and work hard to tackle so many issues, and you sometimes legitimately save lives while doing these jobs.
cons: The non-studen staff could be more inclusive at times (more non-men, more people of color, etc) and when hiring students, they should be more aware of (when possible) applicants that do not deserve to hold leadership positions (people who are known to have assaulted others, etc). Also, unlike at other institutions, your room and board is not fully covered. Instead, you get a single room for the price of a double (meaning it is cheaper than a single would otherwise be), but when you consider the cost of tuition and how many difficult situations come along with working for Campus Life, you realize you aren't necessarily being paid enough to do what you do.

pros: Good for new college student
cons: there are no cons in this

pros: teachers are great, depending on the department
cons: food is not the best

review_title: Benefits a plus, leadership needs work
job_title: Assistant Dean of Students in Appleton, WI
pros:
* Small institution so you can get to know coworkers and students
* Encouraged to think outside the box and make connections
* Benefits package is decent, especially the 403(b) retirement options
cons:
* No clear strategic plan seems to be shared
* No clear values that university seems to be working toward, leaving departments and offices feeling unsure about direction
* Resources being allocated to - what seems like - aesthetics and superficial issues instead of hearing staff concerns and facing them head-on

review_title: One of the best campus jobs for the musically-minded
job_title: Sound Engineer/Stage Manager in Appleton, WI
pros: Tech Crew allows you to set your own schedule and work the gigs that interest you. Meeting student, faculty, and visiting musicians is rarely dull, as everyone is very passionate about their art. Your coworkers are some of the coolest cats on campus.
cons: Because the boss has a type-A, overly analytical personality you must be able to accept criticism readily. Also it can get really boring backstage, so bring some homework.

job_title: Assistant Dean of Students in Appleton, WI
pros:
403b
Health insurance is competitive
Many new changes in the student life realm 
Salary positions seem as extremely flexible and family/life-balance friendly as possible
cons:
Sometimes it seems communication is not strong amongst different areas
Not very values-based leadership 
Parking is at a premium and campus is land-locked

pros: Great intellectual vibe. People are nice and most of the time know what they are doing. The school is small so it's a tight-knitted community.
cons: It's a cliche to say this but the winter in Wisconsin is crazy. If you are okay with walking through a few feet of snow to get to work then the place is alright after all.

Flexible hours

Have to work nights, usually weekends, and definitely every party in the bar which is frustrating if you want to join in.
You start as a barback, then become bartender
